document.docAuthor: Kubendran, T., Vasanth, M., Subramanian, K. A., Jabeen, Fatima, Sivaramakrishnan, K. G. & Mitra, Pallabi
document.docTitle: Platybaetis selvai Kubendran, Vasanth & Subramanian 2021, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species and new record of the genus Platybaetis Müller-Liebenau, 1980 (Ephemeroptera: Baetidae) from Eastern Himalaya, India

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species and new record of the genus Platybaetis Müller-Liebenau, 1980 (Ephemeroptera: Baetidae) from Eastern Himalaya, India

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined.
Holotype :
1 mature larva, INDIA , Arunachal Pradesh , Dibang Valley district , Tangon stream, 27.44119°N , 94.23509°E ,
275 m
,
15.vii.2018
, Coll. Pallabi Mitra ( Reg. No. HARC /I-7197)
.
Paratypes : 2 larvae ( 1 larva on slide: mouthparts, legs & gills) same data as holotype ( Reg. No. HARC /I-7198)
.
Description. Larva. ( Figs 1–2 ) Length: Body 9.5–9.8 mm . Cerci 6.0– 6.2 mm , length of the median caudal filament 10–11 segments ( Fig. 3 ); antennae 1.5–1.6 mm ( Fig. 4 ).

Etymology :
The species name “
selvai
” is abridged patronym of Dr. C. Selvakumar who has significantly contributed to Indian Ephemeroptera taxonomy.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–4.
Platybaetis selvai
sp. nov. ,
Larva. 1. Dorsal view (mature larva); 2. Dorsal view (immature larva); 3. Posterior part of the abdomen ventral view; 4. Head ventral view.

FIGURES 14–20.
Platybaetis selvai
sp. nov. ,
Larva. 14. Fore leg; 15. Middle leg; 16. Hind leg; 17. claw; 18. Femur feathered setae on anterior margin; 19–20. Abdomen posterior margin tergum V.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Ecology. Larvae of
P. selvai
sp. nov.
occurred in a small stream (Tangon, 1.5–2 m wide) on surface of flat rocks. This stream is characterized by medium water temperature (21°С at the time of sampling) and mainly pebbles and silt particles at the bottom of the stream. The locality is densely covered with the canopy of riparian vegetation at low altitude in the Dibang Valley, district of Arunachal Pradesh . Larvae were associated with
Baetis sp.
, Heptageniidae (
Afronurus sp.
,
Notacanthurus sp.
) and Hydropsychidae ( Trichoptera ).
